abstract.p: Thomas P Melady letter praises Edward M Egan, New York's new Roman Catholic archbishop

block.p: Archbishop-elect Edward M. Egan (front page, May 12) was always a leading candidate to be named archbishop of New York when the position became vacant. While serving as the United States ambassador to the Vatican I would hear his name.

The new archbishop was known for his leadership. There was never any doubt that he was a leader, with all its implications. But more important was the respect that the Vatican leaders have for his knowledge of church traditions and culture. And most important, he is a first-class priest.

Archbishop-elect Edward M. Egan (front page, May 12) was always a leading candidate to be named archbishop of New York when the position became vacant. While serving as the United States ambassador to the Vatican I would hear his name.

The new archbishop was known for his leadership. There was never any doubt that he was a leader, with all its implications. But more important was the respect that the Vatican leaders have for his knowledge of church traditions and culture. And most important, he is a first-class priest.
He is fluent in Latin, Italian, French and Spanish, and his brilliance is matched by his interest in people. His success and responsibilities never interfered with the time he gave to people.
